intro: Acmena leptantha, commonly known as the slender-leaved acmena, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. Acmena leptantha is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in coastal environments.
